ticket.title: Rack parameter issue still persists
ticket.original-body:
Hi,
this is my first ticket, so please excuse any mistakes.
I have a very strange issue. I upgraded my Application to Rails 2.3.2 without any problems, then freezed it to vendor/rails and worked through all my specs after I also upgraded Rspec to 1.2.4. At some point (I cannot exactly tell you when) nested parameters didn't work anymore (as described here: https://rails.lighthouseapp.com/projects/8994/tickets/2255-bundled-rack-10-doesnt-loaded-first-in-rails-232).
That means the server receives something like:
{ "post[body]" => "data" }
instead of
{ "post" => { "body" => "data" } }
So I worked through all the forums, deinstalled the gem rack-0.9.1 and checked that I have the commit 39ff550fa88da9a22d8c21ca872f5e4d0d83f8d4 (http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/39ff550fa88da9a22d8c21ca872f5e4d0d83f8d4). That means the bundled rack-1.0 should be loaded, at least my rack.rb reads on line 6
$:.unshift(File.expand_path(File.dirname(__FILE__)))
Still the problem persists and I don't know exactly how to fix this.
Any help is appreciated! Thanks

That means the server receives something like:

So I worked through all the forums, deinstalled the gem rack-0.9.1 and checked that I have the commit 39ff550fa88da9a22d8c21ca872f5e4d0d83f8d4 (http://github.com/rails/rails/commit/39ff550fa88da9a22d8c21ca872f5e4d0d83f8d4). Still the problem persists and I don't know exactly how to fix this.
Any help is appreciated! Thanks

That means the server receives something like:

instead of

So I worked through all the forums, deinstalled the gem rack-0.9.1 and checked that I have the commit 39ff550fa88da9a22d8c21ca872f5e4d0d83f8d4 (http://github.com/rails/rails/co.... That means the bundled rack-1.0 should be loaded, at least my rack.rb reads on line 6

Any help is appreciated! Thanks

version.title: Rack parameter issue still persists

version.body:
I also tried to do this:
$ sudo rake rails:freeze:edge
But all I get is:
cd vendor Downloading Rails from http://dev.rubyonrails.org/archives/rails_edge.zip rake aborted! Operation timed out - connect(2)
I cannot call or reach http://dev.rubyonrails.org , any ideas?
version.body-html:
I also tried to do this:

$ sudo rake rails:freeze:edge

But all I get is:

cd vendor Downloading Rails from http://dev.rubyonrails.org/archi... rake aborted! Operation timed out - connect(2)

I cannot call or reach http://dev.rubyonrails.org , any ideas?
version.title: Rack parameter issue still persists

version.body:
Ok,
$ sudo rake rails:freeze:edge RELEASE=2.3.2.1
was successfull now, so I'm 100% sure I have the correct version. I even deinstalled the ruby gem just to make sure my freezed version is used.
The problem still exists!
For me that means Forms arent working anymore in Rails 2.3.2 - that is kind of a serious issue.
Does anyone has a solution for this?
version.body-html:
Ok,

$ sudo rake rails:freeze:edge RELEASE=2.3.2.1

was successfull now, so I'm 100% sure I have the correct version. I even deinstalled the ruby gem just to make sure my freezed version is used.

The problem still exists!

For me that means Forms arent working anymore in Rails 2.3.2 - that is kind of a serious issue.

Does anyone has a solution for this?
version.title: Rack parameter issue still persists

version.body:
This "bug" is solved, it was just a very stupid mistake. I had accidently frozen the rack-0.9.1 gem with
rake gems:unpack:dependencies
and didn't notice it. A simple
sudo rm -rf vendor/gems/rack-0.9.1
did the trick.
This ticket can be closed.
version.body-html:
This "bug" is solved, it was just a very stupid mistake. I had accidently frozen the rack-0.9.1 gem with

rake gems:unpack:dependencies

and didn't notice it. A simple

sudo rm -rf vendor/gems/rack-0.9.1

did the trick.

This ticket can be closed.
version.title: Rack parameter issue still persists

version.body:
Marked resolved.
I'm curious, though, why you need to use sudo to get stuff out of vendor/gems. Did you unpack gems as root?
version.body-html:
Marked resolved.

I'm curious, though, why you need to use sudo to get stuff out of vendor/gems. Did you unpack gems as root?
version.title: Rack parameter issue still persists

version.body: That could be. Could that lead to any other problems?
